column1: Kata Robata////I love finding great sushi restaurants.  Kata has a happy hour which makes their yummy food cheaper.  The yakitoris are probably the one of the best I've had in Houston.  I would recommend the beef with sea salt.  The mussel dish is also pretty darn good.  Apparently many customers request a bowl of rice to eat with the remaining juices.  There's a very good selection of various Japanese dishes
column2: so you don't have to eat sushi if you don't want to.  Of the ones we ordered
column3: they were unique and very fresh.  Foie gras at a sushi restaurant?  Yes please!  Don't be afraid to ask your waiter/waitress what they recommend.  It's always fun to try new things.  Service is superb.  Your drink will never be half empty.  I definitely look forward to my next visit.
